image.altText: Ariarne Titmus looks at Mollie O'Callaghan as she rolls over a lane rope

props.synopsis: Ariarne Titmus and Mollie O'Callaghan meet in the women's 200 metres freestyle final, with many predicting this may be the race of the Paris Olympics swimming program. Follow live.

title.children: Aussie teammates Titmus and O'Callaghan to face off in blockbuster 200m freestyle final

image.altText: A large number of police officers standing on a street, speaking

props.synopsis: Two children are killed and nine more injured during a stabbing attack in England's north-west that one witness has likened to a "horror movie".

title.children: 'Worst thing I've ever seen': Two children killed, nine injured in UK stabbing attack

image.altText: A text message inducement to gamble sent by Sportsbet

props.synopsis: Gambling inducements are banned in many countries and a parliamentary committee has recommended Australia follow suit, but more than a year later nothing has happened.

title.children: Callum stopped gambling a year ago. Sportsbet is still trying to lure him back

image.altText: A Qantas plane taxies along a runway in overcast conditions while passengers seated inside watch on.

props.synopsis: A new visa that was quietly introduced last week is already giving hope to migrant workers who are battling for justice against exploitation, a leading legal advocate says.

title.children: What we know about a new visa allowing migrants to stay in Australia to take on bosses who exploit them

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: The alleged target of that conspiracy cannot be identified due to an interim non-publication order imposed in court on Monday.

title.children: Two men charged with conspiracy to murder allegedly approached wrong vehicle in 'poorly executed plot'

image.altText: A graphic of a hand asking for money.

props.synopsis: Australian businesses are paying untold amounts in ransom to hackers, but the government hopes to regain some control with a landmark cybersecurity law.

title.children: Most cyber ransoms are paid in secret, but a new law could change that

image.altText: Former TV host Andrew O’Keefe leaves Waverley Police Station after being granted bail Monday, July 29, 2024

props.synopsis: Former TV game show host Andrew O'Keefe is released on bail after spending Sunday night in police custody charged with violating an Apprehended Domestic Violence Order.

title.children: Former TV host released from custody after allegedly breaching domestic violence order

image.altText: Rent sign outside apartment inspection site with people lining up

props.synopsis: The New South Wales government is set to introduce a law banning "no-fault" evictions in NSW, in a move welcomed by renters' advocates but criticised for how long it has taken.

title.children: 'Cruel irony for tenants': Property investors dismayed by no-fault evictions ban for renters

image.altText: Novak Djokovic looks at Rafael Nadal

props.synopsis: If this was the last time Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic meet in a major tennis match, then it was a fitting if heartbreaking finale, as the pair come full circle back to where they first met.

title.children: Djokovic and Nadal come full circle in a final, heartbreakingly lopsided encounter

image.altText: Ariarne Titmus

props.synopsis: As they take their place on the podium after winning a medal, Paris Olympians are being handed a long and skinny box. Here's what's inside.

title.children: Medal-winning athletes are being handed boxes at the Paris Olympics — but what's inside?

image.altText: An Australian flag flies at the Australian embassy in Jakarta after a bomb attack

props.synopsis: In 2002, Jemaah Islamiyah became the most feared terror group in South-East Asia. Now they have publicly renounced violence.

title.children: The extremist group behind the Bali bombings says it has disbanded. Can it be believed?

image.altText: A Qantas plane taxies along a runway in overcast conditions while passengers seated inside watch on.

props.synopsis: A new visa that was quietly introduced last week is already giving hope to migrant workers who are battling for justice against exploitation, a leading legal advocate says.

title.children: What we know about a new visa allowing migrants to stay in Australia to take on bosses who exploit them

image.altText: Young man with long curly hair wearing a black cap, sitting on a couch holding a newborn baby.

props.synopsis: Ned Gronow, 17, was fatally attacked while he slept in his parents' NSW home in 2022. As his killer, Rayne Aylward, awaits his sentence, Ned's parents have told the Supreme Court of the pain of their loss.

title.children: Mother of teen stabbed in his bed tells court she 'cannot unsee the horror' of murder scene

image.altText: A crowd waiting around screens at a train station.

props.synopsis: The man was arrested at a railway site on Sunday after three coordinated arson attacks paralysed most of France's high-speed railway network over the opening weekend of the Paris Olympics.

title.children: Man arrested over French railway arson attacks

image.altText: cattle stand on a snow -covered paddock at jerrong in the east of new south wales

props.synopsis: Temperatures as low as -7C are expected to be felt across the Central West region on Tuesday, with one weather forecaster warning of "unusually low" temperatures statewide.

title.children: Record-breaking sub-zero temperatures expected in NSW tomorrow

image.altText: A man walks next to a girl who stares at him adoringly with a hand on his chest

props.synopsis: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un is preparing his teenage daughter to lead the nuclear-armed state after his death, according to South Korean MPs briefed by Seoul's spy agency.

title.children: Intelligence service says Kim Jong Un preparing daughter to lead North Korea

image.altText: Four female Australian swimmers smile and embrace at poolside after winning an Olympic gold medal.

props.synopsis: Commentator Bob Ballard attracts criticism after likening Australia's gold-medal-winning swimmers to women "doing their makeup".

title.children: Olympics commentator removed over 'outrageous' comment on Australian swim team

image.altText: The entrance of an underground train station with city buildings in the background. Signposts with the letter 'M' nearby.

props.synopsis: The highly anticipated Chatswood to Sydenham route runs under Sydney Harbour, directly linking north-west commuters to the CBD, and is scheduled to open this Sunday.

title.children: Sydney Metro yet to be ticked off by safety regulator days out from scheduled opening

image.altText: Two boxers embrace and hug after their bout.

props.synopsis: After winning Australia's first boxing medal in 33 years in Tokyo, Harry Garside's gold medal hopes have been crushed after losing his first fight in Paris to Hungarian giant-killer Richard Kovacs.

title.children: 'I feel like a failure': Paris heartbreak for Harry Garside as Tokyo bronze medallist makes shock early exit

image.altText: A crowd dressed in black is gathered at a rally

props.synopsis: Israel and Hezbollah last went to war in 2006, but now, with tensions sky high, all-out war looms again amid the Gaza conflict and the Arab world's fight against the West in the name of the Palestinian cause.

title.children: After 18 years on the fringes, the Middle East's most powerful paramilitary group and its biggest foe now sit on the verge of war

image.altText: Woman with short blonde hair in red blazer speaks in front of microphone

props.synopsis: Ousted Home Affairs minister Clare O'Neil has vowed her make her job as Housing Minister about "delivery, delivery, delivery" amid ongoing building industry warnings over the speed at which government's $32 billion housing rollout can ease the supply crisis.

title.children: O'Neil says 'a lot of Australians' don't realise scale of Labor's $32 billion housing plan

image.altText: Two female professional basketballers in action, the one on the left wears green.

props.synopsis: An upset loss to Africa's best national basketball team Nigeria puts the Opals' 2024 Olympic medal hopes in early jeopardy.

title.children: Opals stumble at first hurdle in Paris as 'everything' goes wrong in loss to Nigeria

image.altText: A moustached middle-aged South American man thanks a crowd as he wears a red, yellow and blue starred jacket

props.synopsis: The current president claims a third term in the South American country as the opposition and international observers say exit polls suggest a different result.

title.children: Venezuelan election ends in disputed win for incumbent Nicolás Maduro

image.altText: A house badly damaged by fire with a melted rubbish bin out the front

props.synopsis: A 16-year-old boy who was in the Cessnock home at the time of the fire was treated by paramedics but died at the scene.

title.children: Teenage boy dies in 'chaotic' house fire in NSW Hunter Valley

image.altText: You view an aerial photo of Beirut Airport's three long runways up against a topaz sea and cityscape climbing up nearby hills.

props.synopsis: Australians in Lebanon are warned to leave immediately as the risk of war with Israel increases after rockets fired by militant group Hezbollah killed children in the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights.

title.children: Australians warned not to travel to Lebanon as some flights to Beirut cancelled or delayed amid fears of Israeli attack

image.altText: An upturned train carriage sits beside a railway track with people walking around it and the rest of the train visible behind

props.synopsis: The passenger train was carrying 800 people when it collided with a truck on the railway track, causing a number of the carriages to derail.

title.children: Scores injured in Russia after train hits truck and derails

image.altText: The Belarus team walk together behind its flag

props.synopsis: Athletes are banned from representing Russia and Belarus at this year's Paris Olympic Games, but they can compete as individuals under the banner of the Athlètes Individuels Neutres, or AIN.

title.children: What is the AIN at the Paris Olympics?

image.altText: Shireen Romi wears a blue top in front of an orange backdrop

props.synopsis: Three teenagers who have fled some of the worst atrocities of the 21st century find refuge and catharsis in sharing their stories on the stage.

title.children: Shireen escaped Islamic State fighters. She looks back on those dark days and now sees light

image.altText: Kamala Harris, in a beige suite, looks over her shoulders at the top of aircraft stairs

props.synopsis: In the extraordinary moment when Donald Trump was left bloodied by a would-be assassin's bullet, the political reality changed. Then, it was the Democrats' turn for a dramatic twist.

title.children: Trump seemed indestructible, but a remarkable new dynamic has emerged in the race for the White House

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wears high-vis and a hard hat.

props.synopsis: As Anthony Albanese moves ahead with his Future Made in Australia plan, key stakeholders raise questions about how the scheme will be managed and what rules will apply.

title.children: Should gas giants get subsidies under the PM's signature clean energy scheme?

image.altText: Damien standing under the steel jetty on the beach

props.synopsis: Locals at Catherine Hill Bay have salvaged parts of a century-old timber mining jetty. Now they want to see it used in a Stonehenge-like sculpture for the town.

title.children: Historic village wants 'mini Stonehenge' to honour the region's mining history

image.altText: Commonwealth Bank signage outside Brisbane branch

props.synopsis: Commonwealth Bank has been issued with two fines worth $18,000 each after pleading guilty to not paying long service entitlements to staff.

title.children: Commonwealth Bank fined $36k after pleading guilty to not paying long service entitlements to staff

image.altText: A man with short dark hair wearing sunglasses and a blue spotty face mask

props.synopsis: Adelaide disability worker Arjun Kandel, who raped a woman with an intellectual disability, has been described as "shameless" and "misogynistic" in South Australia's District Court.

title.children: 'Misogynistic monster' who raped woman with an intellectual disability confronted by victim's foster mother in court

image.altText: A drill rig in a field.

props.synopsis: The Queensland farming group that challenged the federal government in court says all parties, including mining giant Glencore, have agreed to terms to end the legal proceedings.

title.children: Agreement reached in court case over plan to inject waste into Great Artesian Basin

image.altText: A woman stands against a pink wall with the sign 'Sydney Creative' behind her and rolls of fabric next to her.

props.synopsis: More people are learning to repair and upcycle their clothing as a way to make their garments last longer and spend less money.

title.children: Clothing repair and upcycling popular as inflation hits household budgets
